author: Sutton Coldfield Observer
title: Fuel spillage forces two lanes on the M6 northbound between...
text:
Comments (0) 
TWO lanes of a stretch of motorway near Erdington have been closed following a fuel spillage. 
Motorists are being warned of long delays after two lanes were closed on the M6 northbound between junction 5 for Castle Bromwich and junction 6 for Birmingham following a collision earlier this morning causing a fuel spill. A HGV has also leaked brake fluid across the carriageway. 
Highways England officials are currently at the scene and say they are "working hard" to clean up the spillage as soon as possible but are urging motorists to use an alternative route if possible.
